summary: The **Brave Bazaar** will be held on **Thursday, December 18** during school hours. Students can use their earned Brave Bucks to purchase items for themselves or as holiday gifts, and larger items will be raffled off. The school is seeking donations of **wrapping paper (partial or full rolls) and/or gift bags** for students to wrap their purchases. You can donate time or goods through the link provided.

title: Winter Baseball Clinic Registration Open
source_title: Winter Wonders Weekly | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
Winter 

Baseball 

Clinic!

Winter Baseball Clinic!

summary:
**Talawanda Baseball Winter Clinic** for grades K-8 on **January 18th and 19th, 9:00AM-11:00AM** at THS Gymnasium. Varsity and junior-varsity staff will teach hitting, fielding, throwing, and pitching/catching. 

**Cost:** One day $30, Two days $50 (discounts for additional family members). Bring baseball glove, water bottle, bat, and helmet. 

**Registration deadline:** January 5th to receive a clinic T-shirt. Register online at https://forms.gle/cgfxGjopmEKmrXpD8 or in-person January 19th. Questions: lykinsm@talawanda.org

title: Holiday Door Decorating Contest Donation Request
source_title: Thankful for You! | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
Did 

Someone 

Say 

CONTEST?

Did Someone Say CONTEST?

TMS will be having our 3rd Annual Holiday Door Decorating contest again. If you have any extra wrapping paper, ribbon, CLEAR PACKING TAPE, craft supplies that you would like to donate we would gladly take them off your hands. Please make any donations to the office and we will let the hallways know that extra supplies have been dropped off. The grand prize this year is an Ice Cream Social for the hallway that wins!Thank you so much for your help!

summary: **TMS (Talawanda Middle School)** is hosting their **3rd Annual Holiday Door Decorating Contest**. Donations of wrapping paper, ribbon, **clear packing tape**, and craft supplies are needed and can be dropped off at the office. The winning hallway will receive an **ice cream social** as the grand prize.

title: Office Procedures for Absences and Medical Forms
source_title: Crisp Air & Good News | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
NOTES 

FROM 

THE 

OFFICE

NOTES FROM THE OFFICE

If your student will be out of school for multiple days; sickness, vacation, injury, etc. and would like to get work for your student. Please let the office or teacher know about your request a few days in advance. Calling the day prior to your departure is not enough time to obtain all of the work that will be missed.When your student has medical forms that need to be completed by a teacher (Vanderbilt Forms) please do not hand them directly to the teachers. Please give them to the guidance counselors to distribute. This will make the process much more efficient. The counselors will collect them and send them directly to the doctor's office for you prior to your students appointment.Thank you so much for your help in these matters.

summary:
**Two important office procedures for families:**
- **Homework requests for absences**: If your student will miss multiple days of school (illness, vacation, injury), request work from the office or teachers **several days in advance**—calling the day before is not sufficient time.
- **Medical forms (Vanderbilt Forms)**: Submit medical forms that need teacher completion to the **guidance counselors**, not directly to teachers. Counselors will distribute them to teachers and send completed forms directly to the doctor's office before appointments.

title: Food Resources and Community Meal Information
source_title: The Thankful Times! | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
CALENDAR 

of 

community 

meals 

and 

TOPPS 

schedule

CALENDAR of community meals and TOPPS schedule

LIST 

of 

all 

Butler 

County 

Food 

Pantries

LIST of all Butler County Food Pantries

Most 

up 

to 

date 

SNAP 

Information

Most up to date SNAP Information

summary:
The Talawanda School District provides several food assistance resources for families in need:
- **Little Free Pantries** available 24/7 outside every TSD building, restocked weekly
- **Backpack Program** offers small weekly food bags on Thursdays/Fridays at elementary buildings (contact building Social Worker)
- **Emergency Food Boxes** available for pick-up or delivery within 24 hours
- Access a **calendar of community meals and TOPPS schedule**, a **list of all Butler County food pantries**, and up-to-date **SNAP information** through the provided links

title: Talent Show Sign-Ups Now Open
source_title: The Thankful Times! | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
TALENT 

SHOW 

SIGN-UPS 

ARE 

NOW 

OPEN!!

TALENT SHOW SIGN-UPS ARE NOW OPEN!!

zoom_out_map
            
Think you’ve got talent? Here’s your chance to shine! Students can sign up for the TMS Talent Show in the cafeteria during lunch. Sign-ups will remain open until all spots are filled.Auditions will begin in November in the band room after school, where participants will perform their acts before a panel of three school staff judges. Once auditions are complete, the final lineup of acts will be announced.Practices will be held after school through April, leading up to a full dress rehearsal and the big performance on April 16th at the Talawanda High School Performing Arts Center.Don’t miss your moment to take the stage—sign up today and show us what you’ve got!

summary: **TMS Talent Show sign-ups** are now open in the cafeteria during lunch until all spots are filled. **Auditions** begin in November in the band room after school with three staff judges. **Practices** run through April after school, with the final **performance on April 16th** at the Talawanda High School Performing Arts Center.

event_info.location: Talawanda High School Performing Arts Center

title: Mental Health Corner: Being Prepared Reduces Stress
source_title: The Thankful Times! | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
~ 

COMMUNITY 

INFORMATION 

~

~ COMMUNITY INFORMATION ~

summary:
**Being Prepared & Mental Health Tips:**
- **Clothes**: Prepare outfits on Sunday for the entire week to reduce morning stress
- **Electronics**: Create a charging station near your desk/table with your backpack so you don't forget devices
- **Homework**: Do homework in a clean, organized spot (not in bed) to improve focus and avoid distractions
- **Organization**: Put papers in color-coordinated folders for each class immediately after class; keep one pocket for due homework

Being prepared today reduces unnecessary stress and anxiety tomorrow. Not being prepared (like forgetting gas or missing shoes) causes avoidable stress that impacts your future self.

title: TMS Mountain Bike Club Year Recap
source_title: The Spooky Scoop! | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
zoom_out_map
            
 The TMS Mountain Bike Club had a great start to the year as we learned how to change our tires, maintenance tips, and practiced bike corner control and how and when to change gears. If your student would like to join in the spring, be on the lookout for up-and-coming dates.

summary: The **TMS Mountain Bike Club** had a successful start to the year, with members learning tire changing, maintenance tips, bike corner control, and proper gear shifting techniques. Students interested in joining should **watch for spring session dates** to be announced.

title: Builder's Club Food Drive for Community Families
source_title: The Spooky Scoop! | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
BUILDER'S 

CLUB 

FOOD 

DRIVE!

BUILDER'S CLUB FOOD DRIVE!

summary:
The **Talawanda Middle School Builders Club** (in partnership with Kiwanis Builders Club and TOPSS) is collecting food donations to help friends and families in the community enjoy a holiday meal. 

**Requested items include:**
- Baking mixes (muffins, brownies, cornbread, cookies)
- Mac n Cheese
- Canned green beans
- Soup (cream of mushroom, cream of chicken)
- Crispy onions in container (for green bean casserole)
- Noodles, pickles, canned fish, potato chips, juice, and candy

**Bring donations to the box in the cafeteria between October 27 and November 5th.** This food drive is TSD approved for distribution.

event_info.title: Builder's Club Food Drive Collection Period
event_info.description:
The **Talawanda Middle School Builders Club** (in partnership with Kiwanis Builders Club and TOPSS) is collecting food donations to help friends and families in the community enjoy a holiday meal. 

*

title: PUSH Grants for Low-Income Homeowners
source_title: The Spooky Scoop! | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
zoom_out_map
            
PUSH provides grants to low-income homeowners in the Talawanda School District for critical and emergency home repairs. Call Jeanne or Sabrina at 513-523-8100 for more information. Application is attached. Http://www.push-oxford.org/

summary: **PUSH** (Promoting Unity, Stability and Housing) provides **grants to low-income homeowners** in the Talawanda School District for critical and emergency home repairs. For more information or to apply, call Jeanne or Sabrina at **513-523-8100** or visit [www.push-oxford.org](http://www.push-oxford.org/).

title: Lost and Found Items at TMS
source_title: The Spooky Scoop! | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
LOST AND FOUND!
The Lost and Found is growing here at TMS. If your student is missing any items please remind them to check out the table in the cafeteria or ask in the office if it is a small item. A CHEVY KEY FOB WAS FOUND IN THE PARKING LOT THIS WEEK. PLEASE CALL THE OFFICE IF YOU HAVE LOST ONE.

summary: The Lost and Found at TMS is growing with unclaimed items. Students missing belongings should check the table in the cafeteria for larger items or ask in the office for small items. **A Chevy key fob was found in the parking lot this week** - contact the office if you've lost one.

title: 7th Grade Cincinnati Museum Center Trip Success
source_title: The Spooky Scoop! | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
7th 

Grade 

Field 

Trip, 

TOTAL 

SUCCESS!!

7th Grade Field Trip, TOTAL SUCCESS!!

Last week, TMS seventh graders had the opportunity to visit the Cincinnati Museum Center where groups could choose to visit the Museum of Natural History or the Museum of Science. Students enjoyed interactive exhibits and were able to see lots of cool artifacts! Afterwards, students visited the 5-story domed Omnimax Theater to watch a film entitled "Deep Sky". Thank you to TMS PTG for helping make this field trip possible! The students had a great time!

summary: TMS seventh graders visited the **Cincinnati Museum Center** last week, choosing between the Museum of Natural History or Museum of Science. Students explored interactive exhibits and artifacts, then watched the film **"Deep Sky"** in the 5-story domed Omnimax Theater. The TMS PTG helped make this successful field trip possible.
